description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6feaf","text":"This protocol describes how to perform gene editing on human induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) via ribonucleoprotein (RNP) and how to the isolate lines with the desired excision. It describes nucleofection, single cell sorting via FACS, genotyping, and the maintenance of the cell lines throughout the process. This protocol is optimized for spCas9.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: Creating iPSC lines with Ribonucleoprotein (RNP) - Nucleofection, Single-cell Sorting, Genotyping, and Line Maintenance Protocol_ClellandLab.pdf

{"blocks":[{"key":"aesnf","text":"Sanger Sequence","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"di0fp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79jrr","text":"Save some PCR product to sanger sequence at a later time.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7otus","text":"Perform 5’ cut site excision PCR (perform only on clones that have the correct excision band).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tjc7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99a11","text":"Design 5’ cut site primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4k983","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35puq","text":"One of the primers should bind on the 5’ outside of the cut site and the other primer should bind within the excision region.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkgvu","text":"Length: If the excision did not occur, the expected length of the band should be between 100 bp and 1000 bp. With the excision, we expect no band","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b2r80","text":"Expectations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arfjr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c1s7i","text":"Unedited line: Expected band size","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84t9a","text":"Homozygous excision: No band","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i2sj","text":"Heterozygous excision: Expected band size","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cg82a","text":"Perform 3’ cut site excision PCR (perform only on clones that have the correct excision band).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3o2l","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nofr","text":"Design 3’ cut site primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4r1ge","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fdii","text":"One of the primers should bind 3’ outside of the cut site and the other primer should bind within the excision region.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2di21","text":"Length: If the excision did not occur, the expected length of the band should be between 100 bp and 1000 bp. With the excision, we expect no band.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2p2bq","text":"Expectations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79up4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ekm","text":"Unedited line: Expected band size.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dftvd","text":"Homozygous excision: No band.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p6q1","text":"Heterozygous excision: Expected band size.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pcga","text":"Send one or two clones with correct excisions to karyotype.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bnb4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68f18","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3c74c","text":"Freeze a few vials (3-4) of all clones you are karyotyping.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3nel","text":"Expand and freeze 10+ vials the clone with the correct excision and normal karyotype.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
